oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Tennessee Woolen Mill
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Tennessee Woolen Mill on the Barren Fork River. View up the hill with water tower. This mill was owned by Asa Faulkner until the 1880s, and was still manufacturing blankets into the 1930s.

This mill was located on the Charles Creek, which empties into the Collins River. It was owned by Asa Faulkner from 1841 until his death in the 1880s. After his death, it was owned by T.H. Faulkner and then Robert Cantrell. The mill was still manufacturing blankets in the 1930s, and its main building burned in the 1950s.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Looking Back at Tennessee Photograph Collection, 1890-1981
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Textile industry; Wool industry; Mills; Water towers; Carriages & coaches
